attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
On 16 December 2009 the Payments Council - which represents the major banks - will vote on whether or not to scrap the cheque as a method of payment in Britain.

Over 4 million cheques are being written each day and many people prefer to pay with goods and services in this way.

Some of Britain's most vulnerable people, including many elderly, disabled and housebound people, rely on cheques as a means of payment and will be greatly inconvenienced by this decision.

The "save the cheque" campaign is backed by a high number of MPs from all political parties, is lead by Cheadle MP Mark Hunter and supported by leading consumer group Which? The campaign seeks to ensure the Payments Council do not decide to abolish the cheque.

government_responses.details:
You signed a petition asking the Prime Minister to "save the cheque by reminding the banks of their duty to serve the customer - and not vice versa - and by asking members of the Payments Council to vote against abolishing the cheque bearing in mind the great inconvenience such a decision would cause to Britain's most vulnerable people."

The Prime Minister's Office has responded to that petition and you can view it here: 

http://www.number10.gov.uk/Page22641
